intro: Clerodendranthus stamineus, commonly known as the Chinese rose or the evergreen Chinese rose, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen, which gives it its species name "stamineus." It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adaptable to a variety of garden conditions.
